intro: Aneilema dregeanum, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It features a rhizomatous root system and produces striking, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are lanceolate and slightly hairy, while the flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. Aneilema dregeanum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is also used in traditional medicine.
